meanings.definition: A noisy, old, or dilapidated vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The old rattletraps in the junkyard clanked loudly.
meanings.sent2: We saw a few rattletraps parked by the roadside.
meanings.sent3: The rattletraps in the parade sounded like a band of pots and pans.
meanings.sent4: The rattletraps on the road seemed to groan with every bump.
meanings.sent5: The rattletraps in the neighborhood always woke us up with their rumbling engines.

meanings.definition: A collection of miscellaneous items or objects.
meanings.sent1: Her desk was filled with rattletraps of all shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent2: The attic was a treasure trove of forgotten rattletraps.
meanings.sent3: The box of rattletraps she brought to the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a cluttered attic of rattletraps, each holding a memory.
meanings.sent5: The shelves were lined with rattletraps, each holding a story of its own.
